    Extra API to make Groovy usage nicer

      • transform

        public static Throwable transform(Throwable self,
                                  @DelegatesTo(value=ExceptionTransformerBuilder.class)
                                  groovy.lang.Closure<?> transformationSpec)
        Manipulate the exception contents on ad-hoc basis
        Parameters:
        self - the target of this extension method
        transformationSpec - a spec closure that will be run on ExceptionTransformerBuilder delegate.
        Returns:
        the transformed exception - typically we would throw or log that.

      • peekField

        public static Object peekField(@NotNull
                               @NotNull Class<?> self,
                               @NotNull
                               @NotNull String fieldName)

        Extract the value of a static field regardless of its visibility. If there are multiple shadowed fields with the given name, return the value of the first found when traversing the inheritance hierarchy starting from the type, until Object.

        You can use this method to easily get Unsafe and cache it for further usage, like this:

        
 public static final def UNSAFE = Unsafe.peekField("theUnsafe") as Unsafe
        Parameters:
        self - the class whose field we are peeking
        fieldName - the name of the field to extract.
        Returns:
        the extracted value of the requested field.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the fieldType is a primitive type.
        See Also:
        Extractors.peekField(Object, Class, String, Class)

      • pokeField

        public static void pokeField(@NotNull
                             @NotNull Class<?> self,
                             @NotNull
                             @NotNull String fieldName,
                             Object value)

        Extract the value of a field regardless of its visibility. If there are multiple shadowed fields with the given name, return the value of the first found when traversing the inheritance hierarchy starting from the type, until Object.

        Parameters:
        self - the class whose field we are peeking
        fieldName - the name of the field to extract.
        value - the desired new value
        See Also:
        Extractors.pokeField(Object, Class, String, Object)
